title: The Ochi day
description: Banks will not be open on The Ochi day, leading to their closure.

title: Industrial Sales YoY
description: In Italy, industrial turnover index measures the monthly changes of industrial sales at current prices.

title: Balance of Trade
source: INEGI - Instituto Nacional de Estadistica, Geografia e Informatica
description: Mexico's main exports are manufactured products (88 percent of total shipments) , followed by oil and oil products (7 percent), the agricultural sector with (4 percent). Main imports are: metallic products, machinery and equipment (59 percent of total purchases), oil products (12 percent) and agricultural goods (3 percent). The country's top trading partner is the United States (72 percent of total exports and 38 percent of total imports). Others include: China, Japan and Germany. In 2022, trade between Mexico and the United States reached USD 738 billion, with Mexico posting a surplus of near USD 208 billion.

title: Wholesale Sales MoM Prel
description: The Monthly Wholesale Trade Survey presents estimates of monthly sales for wholesale merchants in Canada, providing information on the performance of the wholesale trade sector as an important indicator of the health of the Canadian economy. In addition, the business community uses the data to analyse market performance.

title: Fed Barr Speech
description: In the United States, the authority to set interest rates is divided between the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve (Board) and the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). The Board decides on changes in discount rates after recommendations submitted by one or more of the regional Federal Reserve Banks. The FOMC decides on open market operations, including the desired levels of central bank money or the desired federal funds market rate.

title: Michigan Consumer Expectations Final
description: The Index of Consumer Expectations focuses on three areas: how consumers view prospects for their own financial situation, how they view prospects for the general economy over the near term, and their view of prospects for the economy over the long term. Each monthly survey contains approximately 50 core questions, each of which tracks a different aspect of consumer attitudes and expectations. The samples for the Surveys of Consumers are statistically designed to be representative of all American households, excluding those in Alaska and Hawaii. Each month, a minimum of 500 interviews are conducted by telephone.

title: Budget Balance
description: The government budget balance is the difference between government revenues and expenses, excluding public debt charges. The budget is balanced when outlays equal to receipts, the country reports budget surplus when revenues are higher than expenses and deficit when expenses exceed the revenues.

title: Baker Hughes Oil Rig Count
description: US Crude Oil Rigs refer to the number of active US rigs drilling for oil in a given week.

title: Fiscal Balance
source: Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público
description: In Mexico, the public budget includes, not only government expenses and revenues, but also financial balance of entities under indirect budgetary control, and external and internal financing requirement.

title: Republic Day
description: The banks will not be open because it is Republic Day.

title: Daylight Saving Time ends
description: Many European countries end daylight saving time and adjust their clocks by moving them back by one hour.

title: Daylight Saving Time ends
description: The UK discontinues daylight saving time and adjusts clocks by moving them back by 1 hour.

title: Retail Sales MoM Prel
description: In Australia, the Retail sales report provides an aggregated measure of sales of retail goods and services over a specific time period. In Australia, Retail sales are seasonal, volatile and relatively important to the overall economy.

title: October Holiday (Halloween)
description: The banks will not be open because of the October Holiday, which is Halloween.

title: Consumer Confidence
description: The ESRI's Consumer Confidence index is a key indicator which measures the extent to which consumers feel confident about the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it tends to encourage economic growth, whereas low confidence levels are associated with economic decline. A high reading of this index is considered favorable or optimistic for the Euro currency, while a low reading is viewed as unfavorable or pessimistic.

title: Retail Sales s.a. (MoM)
description: The Australian Bureau of Statistics conducts a Retail Sales survey to gather data on goods sold by retailers. This survey includes a sample of various types and sizes of retail stores and is used as an indicator of the Australian economy's pace. It provides insights into the performance of the retail sector in the short and medium term. A high reading suggests positive economic growth, which is favorable for the Australian Dollar (AUD), while a low reading is viewed as negative or unfavorable.

title: Private Sector Credit YoY
description: Private sector credit measures year over year change in the bank lending to domestic private sector.

title: North Rhine Westphalia CPI YoY
description: In Germany, Consumer Price index is the most frequently used indicator of inflation and reflect changes in the cost of acquiring a fixed basket of goods and services by the average consumer.

title: Economic Confidence Index
description: In Turkey, economic confidence index is a composite index that encapsulates consumers’ and producers’ evaluations, expectations and tendencies about general economic situation. The index is combined by means of a weighted aggregation of normalized sub-indices of consumer confidence, seasonally adjusted real sector (manufacturing industry), services, retail trade and construction confidence indices. The economic confidence index indicates an optimistic outlook about the general economic situation when the index is above 100, on contrary it indicates a pessimistic outlook when it is below 100.

title: Bavaria CPI YoY
description: In Germany, Consumer Price index is the most frequently used indicator of inflation and reflect changes in the cost of acquiring a fixed basket of goods and services by the average consumer.

title: Consumer Confidence
description: The Consumer Confidence index, published by Statistics Finland, is an important metric that assesses how confident consumers are in economic activity. When consumer confidence is high, it tends to promote economic growth, whereas low confidence can be a sign of an economic decline. A high reading of this index is considered favorable for the EUR currency, indicating a positive market sentiment, while a low reading is viewed as unfavorable, signaling a negative market sentiment.

title: Net Lending to Individuals MoM
description: In the United Kingdom, Net Lending to Individuals MoM refers to monthly changes of total sterling net lending to individuals and housing associations, excluding the Student Loans Company.

title: Consumer Confidence Final
description: In Euro Area, the Consumer Economic Sentiment Indicator measures the level of optimism that consumers have about the economy. The survey is made by phone and covers 23 000 households in the Euro Area. The number of households sample varies across the zone. The questions focus on current economic and financial situation, savings intention as well as on expected developments regarding: consumer price indexes, general economic situation and major purchases of durable goods. The Consumer ESI measures consumer confidence on a scale of -100 to 100, where -100 indicate extreme lack of confidence, 0 neutrality and 100 extreme confidence.

title: Gross Domestic Product (QoQ)
description: The Statistisches Bundesamt Deutschland releases the Gross Domestic Product, which calculates the overall value of Germany's goods and services produced. It is widely used to gauge the health and activity of the German economy. A strong or higher than anticipated GDP has a positive impact on the EUR, while a decrease in GDP is viewed as negative or bearish.

title: Business Confidence
source: Ministerio de Industria, Comercio y Turismo
description: In Spain, the Industrial Confidence Indicator (ICI) measures the level of optimism of entrepreneurs for the future development of industrial activity. The ICI is conducted based on the sample of 2500 enterprises representing different sizes, regions and sectors of Spanish economy. The response rate is around 60 percent. ICI is measured on a scale of -100 (extreme lack of confidence) to +100 (extreme confidence).

title: Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (YoY)
description: The National Institute of Statistics releases the Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (HICP), which is a measure of inflation that is consistent across EU Member States. It is similar to national Consumer Price Indices (CPI) but includes items such as personal computers, new cars, and airfares, while excluding owner/occupier housing and council tax. A high HICP reading is considered positive for the Euro, while a low reading is considered negative.

title: Trade Balance non-EU
description: The National Institute of Statistics publishes the Trade Balance, which compares the value of exports and imports of goods and services. A positive value indicates a surplus in trade, while a negative value indicates a deficit. This report can cause fluctuations in the value of the Euro currency. If there is a consistent demand for Italian exports, it can lead to a positive growth in the trade balance, which would be beneficial for the Euro.

title: Consumer Confidence
description: The Consumer Confidence index published by Statistics Portugal is a key indicator used to assess the level of confidence consumers have in the state of the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it tends to lead to economic growth, whereas low confidence often leads to economic decline. A high reading of this index is considered positive for the EUR (Euro currency) and is seen as a signal for potential market strength, while a low reading is considered negative for the EUR and is seen as a warning sign for potential market weakness.

title: Harmonised Inflation Rate YoY Prel
description: The Harmonised Index of Consumer Prices (HICP) is an indicator of inflation and price stability for the European Central Bank (ECB). The HICP is compiled by Eurostat and the national statistical institutes in accordance with harmonised statistical methods. The ECB aims to maintain annual inflation rates as measured by the HICP below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.

title: Consumer Confidence
description: The European Commission releases a measure known as the Consumer Confidence, which is a key indicator of how confident consumers are in the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it encourages economic growth, while low confidence often leads to a decline in the economy. A high reading of this indicator is viewed as positive for the EUR currency, while a low reading is seen as negative.

title: Consumer Price Index (MoM)
description: The National Bank of Belgium calculates and publishes the Consumer Price Index (CPI), which tracks changes in the prices of a typical selection of goods and services sold to consumers. Inflation causes the purchasing power of the Euro to decrease. The CPI is an important tool for measuring inflation and shifts in consumer spending patterns. In general, a higher CPI reading is viewed as beneficial for the Euro, while a lower reading is seen as unfavorable.

title: Gross Domestic Product (QoQ)
description: The Belgian National Bank publishes the gross domestic product, which is a measure of the combined value of all goods and services produced in Belgium. GDP is seen as an indicator of overall economic activity and well-being. A high GDP is generally seen as a positive sign for the Euro, indicating growth, while a low GDP is seen as negative, indicating a decline.

title: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Index
description: The Dallas Fed Manufacturing Index measures the performance of manufacturing sector in the state of Texas. The index is derived from a survey of around 100 business executives and tracks variables such as output, employment, orders and prices. A reading above 0 indicates an expansion of the factory activity compared to the previous month; below 0 represents a contraction; while 0 indicates no change. Texas produces around 9.5 percent of manufacturing output in US. The state ranks second behind California in factory production and first as an exporter of manufactured goods.

title: Retail Sales MoM Prel
description: In Australia, the Retail sales report provides an aggregated measure of sales of retail goods and services over a specific time period. In Australia, Retail sales are seasonal, volatile and relatively important to the overall economy.

title: Consumer Price Index (YoY)
description: The consumer price index for Germany, released by the Statistisches Bundesamt Deutschland, calculates the average price movement of goods and services bought by households for consumption. It is the primary measure of inflation and changes in consumer spending habits. A high value is beneficial for the EUR currency, indicating optimism, while a low value is detrimental, suggesting pessimism.

title: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Business Index
description: Every month, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas conducts the Texas Manufacturing Outlook Survey to gather information about the current state of factory activity in Texas. Companies are surveyed about changes in output, employment, orders, prices, and other factors compared to the previous month. The survey responses are used to calculate an index for each indicator, which is determined by subtracting the percentage of respondents reporting a decrease from the percentage reporting an increase.

title: Fiscal Balance
source: Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público
description: In Mexico, the public budget includes, not only government expenses and revenues, but also financial balance of entities under indirect budgetary control, and external and internal financing requirement.

title: ECB Enria Speech
description: In the Euro Area, benchmark interest rate is set by the Governing Council of the European Central Bank. The primary objective of the ECB’s monetary policy is to maintain price stability which is to keep inflation below, but close to 2 percent over the medium term. In times of prolonged low inflation and low interest rates, ECB may also adopt non-standard monetary policy measures, such as asset purchase programmes. The official interest rate is the Main refinancing operations rate.

title: 6-Month Bill Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on the Treasury bills sold by the US Department of Treasury. These bills are short-term securities that mature in one year or less. The return on the bills signifies the amount of money an investor will earn by holding the bond until it reaches maturity. Investors track the volatility of the return and compare the average rate at each auction to previous rates for the same security. This helps them gauge the overall state of government debt.

title: Unemployment Rate
description: The Unemployment Rate, published by the Central Bank of the Russian Federation, is calculated by dividing the number of people without work by the total number of people in the workforce who are not in the military. It is an important indicator for the Russian economy, as it represents the level of joblessness. A higher rate indicates limited growth within the job market, which can result in a weaker economy overall. Conversely, a lower rate is generally viewed as a positive sign for the Russian Ruble currency, while an increase in the rate is seen as negative.

title: BoC Gov Macklem Speech
description: In Canada, benchmark interest rate is set by the Bank of Canada's (BoC) Governing Council. The official interest rate is the Overnight Rate. Since 1996 the Bank Rate is set at the upper limit of an operating band for the money market overnight rate. Previously, from March 1980 until February 1996 the Bank Rate was set at 25 basis points above the weekly average tender rate for 3-month Treasury bills.

title: Private Sector Credit YoY
description: Private sector credit measures year over year change in the bank lending to domestic private sector.

title: North Rhine Westphalia CPI YoY
description: In Germany, Consumer Price index is the most frequently used indicator of inflation and reflect changes in the cost of acquiring a fixed basket of goods and services by the average consumer.

title: Building Permits MoM
description: In New Zealand, the Building Consents Issued release summarizes information on all building consents issued, for more than $4,999, within New Zealand during the reference month. A dwelling is a construction that is built for habitation. Within an apartment building, each separate apartment is considered a dwelling. Number of new dwelling units authorized includes government dwellings.

title: Economic Confidence Index
description: In Turkey, economic confidence index is a composite index that encapsulates consumers’ and producers’ evaluations, expectations and tendencies about general economic situation. The index is combined by means of a weighted aggregation of normalized sub-indices of consumer confidence, seasonally adjusted real sector (manufacturing industry), services, retail trade and construction confidence indices. The economic confidence index indicates an optimistic outlook about the general economic situation when the index is above 100, on contrary it indicates a pessimistic outlook when it is below 100.

title: BoC's Governor Macklem speech
description: Tiff Macklem took on the role of Governor of the Bank of Canada on June 3, 2020, making him both the Governor and Chairman of the Bank's Board of Directors. Before his appointment, Macklem served as the Dean of the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto for six years. He also held the position of Senior Deputy Governor at the Bank of Canada from July 2010 to May 2014. In addition, Macklem was the first Chair of the Financial Stability Board's Standing Committee for Standards Implementation from 2009 to 2013, and represented the Bank of Canada at the FSB.

title: RBA Jones Speech
description: In Australia, interest rates decisions are taken by the Reserve Bank of Australia's Board. The official interest rate is the cash rate. The cash rate is the rate charged on overnight loans between financial intermediaries, is determined in the money market as a result of the interaction of demand for and supply of overnight funds.

title: Jobs/applications ratio
source: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare
description: The series refers to the ratio of active job openings to applicants is a rate of the number of job offers (sum of the carried forward ones from the previous month and new ones) to the number of job seekers registered at public employment security offices ("Hello Work") all over the country. It indicates the number of job offers per one job seeker. The ratio is obtained by dividing monthly active job openings by monthly active applications.

title: Industrial Production MoM Prel
source: Ministry of Economy Trade and Industry (METI)
description: In Japan, industrial production measures the output of businesses integrated in industrial sector of the economy such as manufacturing, mining, and utilities.

title: Bavaria CPI YoY
description: In Germany, Consumer Price index is the most frequently used indicator of inflation and reflect changes in the cost of acquiring a fixed basket of goods and services by the average consumer.

title: ANZ Business Confidence
description: In New Zealand, the business confidence index is designed to provide a snapshot of business opinions regarding the expected future state of their business and economy overall. The survey covers around 700 respondents. The Net index is calculated by subtracting the percentage number of businesses that expect that the economic situation improves from the number that expect decline.

title: Fiscal Balance, pesos
description: The Fiscal Balance, provided by SCHP, is the contrast between the revenue collected by the government and the amount it spends. In simple terms, if the result is negative, it indicates that Mexico's financial situation is positive, which is beneficial for the Peso. Conversely, an increase in the federal deficit is seen as unfavorable.

title: Net Lending to Individuals MoM
description: In the United Kingdom, Net Lending to Individuals MoM refers to monthly changes of total sterling net lending to individuals and housing associations, excluding the Student Loans Company.

title: Private Sector Credit MoM
description: In Australia, private sector credit refers to the month-over-month change of credit extended to the economy's private sector for housing, personal and business expenditures. It includes securitizations.

title: Building Permits s.a. (MoM)
description: The Statistics New Zealand has released data on Building Permits s.a., which tracks the amount of permits issued for new construction projects. This data is commonly used as an indicator for the state of the housing market. When there is a larger number of permits issued, it is seen as a positive sign (or bullish) for the NZD, while a smaller number of permits is seen as negative (or bearish).

title: Consumer Confidence Final
description: In Euro Area, the Consumer Economic Sentiment Indicator measures the level of optimism that consumers have about the economy. The survey is made by phone and covers 23 000 households in the Euro Area. The number of households sample varies across the zone. The questions focus on current economic and financial situation, savings intention as well as on expected developments regarding: consumer price indexes, general economic situation and major purchases of durable goods. The Consumer ESI measures consumer confidence on a scale of -100 to 100, where -100 indicate extreme lack of confidence, 0 neutrality and 100 extreme confidence.

title: Day of Reformation
description: Today, the banks will not be open.

title: Business Confidence
source: Ministerio de Industria, Comercio y Turismo
description: In Spain, the Industrial Confidence Indicator (ICI) measures the level of optimism of entrepreneurs for the future development of industrial activity. The ICI is conducted based on the sample of 2500 enterprises representing different sizes, regions and sectors of Spanish economy. The response rate is around 60 percent. ICI is measured on a scale of -100 (extreme lack of confidence) to +100 (extreme confidence).

title: Unemployment Rate
description: The Unemployment Rate in Japan is calculated by the Ministry of Health, Labour, and Welfare and published by the Japan Statistics Bureau. It represents the percentage of people who are unemployed in Japan. A higher rate suggests that the labor market is weak, which can impact the overall strength and direction of the Japanese economy. On the other hand, a lower rate is considered positive or bullish for the Japanese yen.

title: Retail Trade (YoY)
description: The Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry collects data on the Retail Trade, which represents the total sales made by businesses primarily engaged in selling goods and services to the public for personal or household use. This information is crucial for understanding consumer spending, which is a significant factor in the Japanese economy. A high reading is beneficial for the Japanese yen (JPY), while a low reading is unfavorable.

title: BoJ Interest Rate Decision
description: In Japan, interest rates are set by the Bank of Japan's Policy Board in its Monetary Policy Meetings. The BoJ's official interest rate is the discount rate. Monetary Policy Meetings produce a guideline for money market operations in inter-meeting periods and this guideline is written in terms of a target for the uncollateralized overnight call rate.

title: ANZ Business Confidence
description: The ANZ releases a report called Business Confidence which provides insight into the business outlook in New Zealand. This report is useful for analyzing the current economic situation in the short term. When the numbers in the report increase, it indicates that there is an increase in business investment, which in turn leads to higher levels of output. As a result, a high reading in the report is viewed as positive or optimistic for the New Zealand Dollar (NZD), while a low reading is seen as negative or pessimistic.

title: BRC Shop Price Index (YoY)
description: The BRC Shop Price Index is used to track price changes in the UK's major retail stores. It is also used as a guide to gauge inflationary trends. A high reading is considered favorable for the GBP, while a low reading is considered unfavorable.

title: Private Sector Credit (MoM)
description: The Private Sector Credit is a value reported by the Reserve Bank of Australia, indicating the amount of money borrowed by the private sector in the country. It serves as a measure of the private sector's ability to handle major expenses, which in turn can contribute to economic growth. This data is often considered as an indicator of business conditions and the overall state of the Australian economy. Typically, a high reading is viewed favorably and can have a positive impact on the value of the Australian dollar (AUD), while a low reading is seen as unfavorable.

title: Harmonised Inflation Rate YoY Prel
description: The Harmonised Index of Consumer Prices (HICP) is an indicator of inflation and price stability for the European Central Bank (ECB). The HICP is compiled by Eurostat and the national statistical institutes in accordance with harmonised statistical methods. The ECB aims to maintain annual inflation rates as measured by the HICP below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.

title: NBS Manufacturing PMI
description: The China Federation of Logistics & Purchasing (CFLP) measures business conditions in the Chinese manufacturing sector through the Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI). A reading above 50 indicates growth, while a reading below 50 indicates decline. Given the significant role of the Chinese economy in the global economy, this economic indicator can affect the Forex market.

title: Housing Starts YoY
source: Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism
description: In Japan, housing starts refers to the year-on-year change in volume of new housing construction started.

title: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Index
description: The Dallas Fed Manufacturing Index measures the performance of manufacturing sector in the state of Texas. The index is derived from a survey of around 100 business executives and tracks variables such as output, employment, orders and prices. A reading above 0 indicates an expansion of the factory activity compared to the previous month; below 0 represents a contraction; while 0 indicates no change. Texas produces around 9.5 percent of manufacturing output in US. The state ranks second behind California in factory production and first as an exporter of manufactured goods.

title: BoJ Monetary Policy Statement
description: The Policy Board of the Bank of Japan issues an official statement about its monetary policy. This statement reveals the committee's decisions on interest rates and other policy measures, and also discusses the economic factors that influenced their choices. The statement provides insight into potential future changes in the bank's monetary policy.

title: GDP Growth Rate YoY Prel
description: France is the seventh largest economy in the world and the second largest in the Euro Area. France has a large and diversified industrial and agricultural base which includes aircraft, military equipment, perfumes, pharmaceuticals, wine, beef and wheat production. With at least 82 million foreign tourists per year, France is the most visited country in the world and maintains the third largest income in the world from tourism. Services are the biggest sector of the economy (79 percent of total GDP) while industry accounts for 19 percent. Agriculture contributes 2 percent to GDP, yet France is the second largest exporter of agricultural products in the world.

title: Balance of Trade Final
description: The Turkish trade balance has been in deficit since 1947. Turkey major exports are road vehicles, textiles, iron and steel, clothing and food, while imports were machinery and transport equipment, manufactured goods, mineral fuels and lubricants and chemicals. The biggest trade deficits were recorded with China, Russia, Germany, South Korea, Switzerland, India, Iran and Japan; and the largest surpluses were recorded with Iraq, the UAE, the UK, Israel, Syria, Northern Cyprus and Azerbaijan.

title: Retail Sales MoM
description: In Switzerland, the Retail sales report provides an aggregated measure of sales of retail goods and services over a specific time period. In Switzerland, Retail sales are seasonal, volatile and relatively important to the overall economy.

title: Tourist Arrivals YoY
description: In Turkey, tourist arrivals refer to the number of visiting foreigners.

title: Construction Orders (YoY)
description: The Construction Orders report, released by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism, provides data on the amount of orders received by construction companies. This data is important for assessing the state of the housing market in Japan. A higher reading is viewed positively (or bullish) for the Japanese yen, while a lower reading is seen as negative (or bearish).

title: Retail Sales (YoY)
description: The Netherlands Statistics Office releases data on retail sales, which measures the fluctuations in the sales of the retail industry in the Netherlands. This data provides insights into the industry's performance in the near future. The percentage change indicates the rate of sales growth or decline. Retail sales data is closely watched as an indicator of consumer spending. A higher index is seen as a positive trend for the EUR, while a lower index suggests a negative trend for the EUR.

title: Current Account
description: Current Account is the sum of the balance of trade (exports minus imports of goods and services), net factor income (such as interest and dividends) and net transfer payments (such as foreign aid).

title: BoJ Press Conference
description: The governor of the Bank of Japan holds a press conference to engage with investors about monetary policy. During the conference, he discusses the factors that influenced the recent decision on interest rates, the general economic forecast, inflation, and gives indications about what to expect in terms of future monetary policy.

title: Gross Domestic Product (QoQ)
description: The INSEE's release of the Gross Domestic Product measures the overall worth of France's produced goods and services. The GDP is widely regarded as an indicator of economic activity and well-being. An upward trend has a favorable impact on the Euro, while a downward trend is viewed as unfavorable or bearish.

title: Retail Sales (YoY)
description: The Retail Sales data provided by the German Federal Statistical Office measures the fluctuations in sales within the retail industry of Germany. This data is used to evaluate the performance of the retail sector in the near future. The percentage changes in retail sales indicate the rate at which sales are changing. These changes are closely monitored as an indicator of consumer spending. A higher percentage change is generally considered positive for the Euro (EUR), signaling anticipated economic growth, while a lower reading is viewed as negative (bearish) for the EUR.

title: 10-Year BTP Auction
description: Generally, a government bond is issued by a national government and is denominated in the country`s own currency. Bonds issued by national governments in foreign currencies are normally referred to as sovereign bonds. The yield required by investors to loan funds to governments reflects inflation expectations and the likelihood that the debt will be repaid.

title: Real Retail Sales (YoY)
description: The Swiss Federal Statistical Office is responsible for conducting the Retail Sales survey. This survey measures the amount of goods that were sold in the previous month and is used to gauge consumer demand in Switzerland. The figures provided are adjusted for inflation and are not influenced by seasonal factors. Typically, a rise in these figures is considered positive for the CHF currency, while a decline is seen as negative.

title: Consumer Price Index (EU norm) (YoY)
description: The INSEE's Consumer Price Index, which compares the prices of goods and services in a typical shopping basket, is used to track price fluctuations. Inflation negatively affects the purchasing power of the Euro. The CPI is an important measure of inflation and trends in consumer spending. In general, a higher CPI is viewed as positive for the Euro, while a lower CPI is considered negative.

title: PPI YoY
description: In Italy, the industrial producer price index measures the evolution of output prices for goods manufactured in Italy and sold on the domestic and non-domestic markets.

title: Foreign Arrivals
description: The Foreign Arrivals data published by TurkStat monitors the quantity of tourists coming to Turkey. Since the tourism sector plays a significant role in the country's total GDP, the number of arrivals serves as a crucial gauge of the overall economic situation. Usually, a high figure is considered favorable (or bullish) for the value of the Lira, whereas a low figure is seen as unfavorable (or bearish).

title: Balance of Trade
description: In 2021, South Africa recorded a trade surplus for the fifth consecutive year. The top exports of South Africa are mineral products; base metals and articles of base metal; vehicles and aircraft vessels and machinery (6.8 percent), shipped primarily to China, the United States and Germany. The top imports of South Africa are machinery, mineral products, chemicals and vehicles & transport equipment, sourced mainly from China, India and the United States.

title: Gross Domestic Product (QoQ)
description: The National Institute of Statistics releases the Gross Domestic Product, which is a measure of Italy's total production value. The GDP is widely used to assess economic activity and well-being. In general, a high GDP reading is viewed positively for the Euro, indicating a bullish trend, while a downward trend is seen as negative or bearish.

title: GDP MoM
description: In Canada, Monthly GDP MoM measures the change in the value of the goods and services produced by the country's economy compared to the previous month.

title: Consumer Price Index (YoY)
description: The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a tool used by Statistics Portugal to track the changes in prices of a variety of goods and services. It helps determine the purchasing power of the Euro (EUR), as inflation can affect its value. The CPI is an important gauge for measuring inflation and shifts in consumer spending habits. Typically, a high CPI is considered beneficial for the EUR, while a low CPI is seen as unfavorable.

title: Building Permits MoM
description: In New Zealand, the Building Consents Issued release summarizes information on all building consents issued, for more than $4,999, within New Zealand during the reference month. A dwelling is a construction that is built for habitation. Within an apartment building, each separate apartment is considered a dwelling. Number of new dwelling units authorized includes government dwellings.

title: Redbook YoY
description: The Johnson Redbook Index is a sales-weighted of year-over-year same-store sales growth in a sample of large US general merchandise retailers representing about 9,000 stores. Same-store sales are sales in stores continuously open for 12 months or longer. By dollar value, the Index represents over 80% of the equivalent 'official' retail sales series collected and published by the US Department of Commerce. Redbook compiles the Index by collecting and interpreting performance estimates from retailers. The Index and its sub-groups are sales-weighted aggregates of these estimates. Weeks are retail weeks (Sunday to Saturday), and equally weighted within the month.

title: House Price Index
description: The FHFA (Federal Housing Finance Agency) House Price Index measures month over month changes in average prices of single-family houses with mortgages guaranteed by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

title: Core Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (MoM)
description: Eurostat, the organization responsible for collecting statistical data for the European Union, released the Core Harmonized Index of Consumer Prices (HICP). This index measures how prices of goods and services in a representative shopping basket change over time, excluding volatile components like food, energy, alcohol, and tobacco. The Core HICP is an important tool for tracking inflation and changes in consumer spending patterns. Typically, a higher reading of the index is viewed as positive or favorable for the value of the EUR currency, while a lower reading is seen as negative.

title: 5-y Bond Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on the Buoni del Tesoro Poliannuali (BTP) auctions, which are bonds issued by the Italian Ministry of Economy and Finance. These bonds have different maturities ranging from three to thirty years. The yield on the BTP bonds indicates the rate of return that an investor can expect by holding the bond until it matures. Investors keep track of the volatility of this yield and compare the average rate at each auction to previous rates for the same bond as a way to gauge the government's debt situation.

title: Chicago PMI
description: The Chicago PMI (ISM-Chicago Business Barometer) measures the performance of the manufacturing and non-manufacturing sector in the Chicago region. The Index is computed from five weighted raw indexes: Production (0.25), New Orders (0.35), Order Backlog (0.15), Employment (0.10), and Supplier Deliveries (0.15) and then seasonally adjusted to support month-to-month comparisons. A reading above 50 indicates an expansion; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change. Chicago PMI is released one day before the ISM Manufacturing Index.

title: Producer Price Index (MoM)
description: The Producer Price Index (PPI) is a measure of the average price changes in the primary markets of Italy, specifically for commodities produced at different stages of processing. It is released by the National Institute of Statistics. The PPI is closely monitored as it provides insights into commodity inflation. In general, a high PPI reading is considered positive or bullish for the Euro, while a low reading is seen as negative or bearish.

title: Jobs/applications ratio
source: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare
description: The series refers to the ratio of active job openings to applicants is a rate of the number of job offers (sum of the carried forward ones from the previous month and new ones) to the number of job seekers registered at public employment security offices ("Hello Work") all over the country. It indicates the number of job offers per one job seeker. The ratio is obtained by dividing monthly active job openings by monthly active applications.

title: Dallas Fed Services Index
description: The Dallas Fed conducts the Texas Service Sector Outlook Survey monthly to obtain a timely assessment of the state's service sector activity. Firms are asked whether revenue, employment, prices, general business activity and other indicators increased, decreased or remained unchanged over the previous month. Responses are aggregated into balance indexes where positive values generally indicate growth while negative values generally indicate contraction.

title: Industrial Production MoM Prel
source: Ministry of Economy Trade and Industry (METI)
description: In Japan, industrial production measures the output of businesses integrated in industrial sector of the economy such as manufacturing, mining, and utilities.

title: ANZ Business Confidence
description: In New Zealand, the business confidence index is designed to provide a snapshot of business opinions regarding the expected future state of their business and economy overall. The survey covers around 700 respondents. The Net index is calculated by subtracting the percentage number of businesses that expect that the economic situation improves from the number that expect decline.

title: Private Sector Credit MoM
description: In Australia, private sector credit refers to the month-over-month change of credit extended to the economy's private sector for housing, personal and business expenditures. It includes securitizations.

title: Employment Cost Index
description: The Employment Cost Index (ECI) is a measure released by the US Bureau of Labour Statistics on a quarterly basis. It tracks the change in the cost of labor, specifically compensation per employee hour worked. This index is closely monitored by economists as it provides insight into cost pressures in companies, which may result in inflation for the prices of goods and services. The ECI includes not only changes in wages and salaries, but also a wide range of benefits.

title: Redbook Index (YoY)
description: The Johnson Redbook Index, which is published by Redbook Research Inc., measures the annual growth in sales for the same stores in a sample group of major US general merchandise retailers. This index is weighted based on sales volume and represents approximately 9,000 stores. In terms of monetary value, the index accounts for over 80% of the official retail sales figures collected and published by the US Department of Commerce.

title: Housing Price Index (MoM)
description: The Federal Housing Finance Agency releases the Housing Price Index, which gives an estimated assessment of the state of the housing market. This index is significant because the housing market has an impact on the US economy. In general, a high reading is viewed as a positive sign for the USD, while a low reading is seen as negative.

title: ECB Guindos Speech
description: In the Euro Area, benchmark interest rate is set by the Governing Council of the European Central Bank. The primary objective of the ECB’s monetary policy is to maintain price stability which is to keep inflation below, but close to 2 percent over the medium term. In times of prolonged low inflation and low interest rates, ECB may also adopt non-standard monetary policy measures, such as asset purchase programmes. The official interest rate is the Main refinancing operations rate.

title: Chicago Purchasing Managers' Index
description: The ISM-Chicago, Inc releases the Chicago Purchasing Managers Index, which measures business conditions in Illinois, Indiana, and Michigan. It is a reliable indicator of business trends and is closely connected to the ISM manufacturing Index. This index is commonly used to assess the overall economic situation in the United States. If the result is above 50, it is seen as positive for the USD, while a result below 50 is considered negative.

title: Consumer Confidence
description: The Consumer Confidence index, released by the Conference Board, measures people's trust and optimism in the economy. When consumer confidence is high, it encourages economic growth, while low confidence contributes to an economic decline. In general, a high Consumer Confidence reading is favorable for the US dollar, while a low reading is unfavorable. Please note that due to restrictions imposed by the Conference Board, our Economic Calendar does not provide specific figures for this indicator.

title: BoJ Interest Rate Decision
description: In Japan, interest rates are set by the Bank of Japan's Policy Board in its Monetary Policy Meetings. The BoJ's official interest rate is the discount rate. Monetary Policy Meetings produce a guideline for money market operations in inter-meeting periods and this guideline is written in terms of a target for the uncollateralized overnight call rate.

title: 52-Week Bill Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on the bonds sold by the US Department of Treasury. These bonds, called Treasury bills, are short-term investments that mature in one year or less. The return, or yield, on the bills indicates the profit that an investor will make by holding the bond until it matures. Investors track the volatility of the yield and compare the average rate at current auctions to previous auctions of the same type of bond. This helps them gauge the government's level of debt.

title: German Buba President Nagel speech
description: Joachim Nagel became the President of the Deutsche Bundesbank on January 1, 2022, taking over from Jens Weidmann who stepped down. Prior to his appointment, Nagel held a senior position at the Bank for International Settlements starting from 2020. He previously served on the board of the Bundesbank from 2010 to 2016.

title: Housing Starts YoY
source: Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism
description: In Japan, housing starts refers to the year-on-year change in volume of new housing construction started.

title: RBNZ Financial Stability Report
description: In New Zealand, interest rates decisions are taken by the Reserve Bank of New Zealand. The official interest rate is the Official Cash Rate (OCR). The OCR was introduced in March 1999 and is reviewed eight times a year by the Bank. The OCR influences the price of borrowing money in New Zealand and provides the Reserve Bank with a means of influencing the level of economic activity and inflation.

title: API Crude Oil Stock Change
description: Stocks of crude oil refer to the weekly change of the crude oil supply situation.

title: GDP Growth Rate YoY Prel
description: France is the seventh largest economy in the world and the second largest in the Euro Area. France has a large and diversified industrial and agricultural base which includes aircraft, military equipment, perfumes, pharmaceuticals, wine, beef and wheat production. With at least 82 million foreign tourists per year, France is the most visited country in the world and maintains the third largest income in the world from tourism. Services are the biggest sector of the economy (79 percent of total GDP) while industry accounts for 19 percent. Agriculture contributes 2 percent to GDP, yet France is the second largest exporter of agricultural products in the world.

title: Labour Costs Index QoQ
description: In New Zealand, the labor cost index measures changes in salary and wage rates for a fixed quantity and quality of labor input.

title: Balance of Trade Final
description: The Turkish trade balance has been in deficit since 1947. Turkey major exports are road vehicles, textiles, iron and steel, clothing and food, while imports were machinery and transport equipment, manufactured goods, mineral fuels and lubricants and chemicals. The biggest trade deficits were recorded with China, Russia, Germany, South Korea, Switzerland, India, Iran and Japan; and the largest surpluses were recorded with Iraq, the UAE, the UK, Israel, Syria, Northern Cyprus and Azerbaijan.

title: Judo Bank Manufacturing PMI Final
description: The Judo Bank Australia Manufacturing PMI is compiled by S&P Global from responses to monthly questionnaires sent to purchasing managers in a panel of around 400 manufacturers. The headline figure is the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), which is a weighted average of the following five indices: New Orders (30%), Output (25%), Employment (20%), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15%) and Stocks of Purchases (10%). For the PMI calculation the Suppliers’ Delivery Times Index is inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction to the other indices. The index varies between 0 and 100, with a reading above 50 indicating an overall increase compared to the previous month, and below 50 an overall decrease.

title: Retail Sales MoM
description: In Switzerland, the Retail sales report provides an aggregated measure of sales of retail goods and services over a specific time period. In Switzerland, Retail sales are seasonal, volatile and relatively important to the overall economy.

title: Tourist Arrivals YoY
description: In Turkey, tourist arrivals refer to the number of visiting foreigners.

title: RBNZ Financial Stability Report
description: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand publishes the Financial Stability Report twice a year. This report evaluates and provides information on the strength and effectiveness of the financial system in New Zealand.

title: CoreLogic Dwelling Prices MoM
description: In Australia, the CoreLogic Home Value Index aims to measure month to month movements in the value of Australian housing markets. Rather than relying solely on transacted sale prices to provide a measure of housing market conditions, the CoreLogic Home Value Index is based on a ‘hedonic’ methodology which includes the attributes of properties that are transacting as part of the analysis. The Home Values Index provides monthly capital growth measurements across three broad housing types: detached houses, units and a combined dwellings index that includes both houses and units. The Index results are released on the last working day of each month and are available on a subscription basis.

title: API Weekly Crude Oil Stock
description: The Weekly Statistical Bulletin (WSB) by API provides information on refinery operations and production of the four main petroleum products in the United States: motor gasoline, jet fuel, distillate, and residual fuel oil. These products make up over 85% of the total petroleum industry.

title: Current Account
description: Current Account is the sum of the balance of trade (exports minus imports of goods and services), net factor income (such as interest and dividends) and net transfer payments (such as foreign aid).

title: Jibun Bank Manufacturing PMI Final
description: The au Jibun Bank Japan Manufacturing PMI is compiled by S&P Global from responses to monthly questionnaires sent to purchasing managers in a panel of around 400 manufacturers. The headline figure is the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), which is a weighted average of the following five indices: New Orders (30%), Output (25%), Employment (20%), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15%) and Stocks of Purchases (10%). For the PMI calculation the Suppliers’ Delivery Times Index is inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction to the other indices. The index varies between 0 and 100, with a reading above 50 indicating an overall increase compared to the previous month, and below 50 an overall decrease.

title: Employment Change
description: The Employment Change is a data released by Statistics New Zealand that shows how the number of people employed in New Zealand has changed. When this indicator goes up, it usually means that people are spending more money, which helps the economy grow. A high reading is considered good for the value of the New Zealand dollar, while a low reading is considered bad.

title: RBNZ's Governor Orr speech
description: Starting in March 2018, Adrian Orr will assume the role of Governor of the Reserve Bank of New Zealand. The main objective of the Reserve Bank is to ensure price stability, as outlined in the Policy Targets Agreement (PTA). The current PTA mandates the Bank to maintain inflation within the range of 1 to 3 percent over the medium term. To achieve this, the Bank adjusts the Official Cash Rate (OCR) during its eight annual reviews as part of its monetary policy implementation.

title: 10-Year BTP Auction
description: Generally, a government bond is issued by a national government and is denominated in the country`s own currency. Bonds issued by national governments in foreign currencies are normally referred to as sovereign bonds. The yield required by investors to loan funds to governments reflects inflation expectations and the likelihood that the debt will be repaid.

title: PPI YoY
description: In Italy, the industrial producer price index measures the evolution of output prices for goods manufactured in Italy and sold on the domestic and non-domestic markets.

title: All Saints' Day
description: The banks will be shut down because of the observance of All Saints' Day.

title: Balance of Trade
description: In 2021, South Africa recorded a trade surplus for the fifth consecutive year. The top exports of South Africa are mineral products; base metals and articles of base metal; vehicles and aircraft vessels and machinery (6.8 percent), shipped primarily to China, the United States and Germany. The top imports of South Africa are machinery, mineral products, chemicals and vehicles & transport equipment, sourced mainly from China, India and the United States.

title: Purchasing Manager Index Manufacturing
description: The Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) provided by Markit Economics is a measure of the state of the manufacturing sector. It serves as a crucial indicator of business conditions and the overall economic situation in Ireland. If the PMI score surpasses 50, it indicates a positive outlook for the Euro, but if it falls below 50, it is considered negative.

title: GDP MoM
description: In Canada, Monthly GDP MoM measures the change in the value of the goods and services produced by the country's economy compared to the previous month.

title: Building Permits (MoM)
description: The data shared by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, known as Building Permits, reflects the quantity of permits granted for new construction projects in Australia. This information provides insights into the level of corporate investments being made, which ultimately impact the country's economic development. As a result, it tends to create fluctuations in the value of the Australian dollar (AUD). A higher number of permits indicates a more optimistic (or bullish) outlook for the AUD.

title: Redbook YoY
description: The Johnson Redbook Index is a sales-weighted of year-over-year same-store sales growth in a sample of large US general merchandise retailers representing about 9,000 stores. Same-store sales are sales in stores continuously open for 12 months or longer. By dollar value, the Index represents over 80% of the equivalent 'official' retail sales series collected and published by the US Department of Commerce. Redbook compiles the Index by collecting and interpreting performance estimates from retailers. The Index and its sub-groups are sales-weighted aggregates of these estimates. Weeks are retail weeks (Sunday to Saturday), and equally weighted within the month.

title: House Price Index
description: The FHFA (Federal Housing Finance Agency) House Price Index measures month over month changes in average prices of single-family houses with mortgages guaranteed by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

title: Chicago PMI
description: The Chicago PMI (ISM-Chicago Business Barometer) measures the performance of the manufacturing and non-manufacturing sector in the Chicago region. The Index is computed from five weighted raw indexes: Production (0.25), New Orders (0.35), Order Backlog (0.15), Employment (0.10), and Supplier Deliveries (0.15) and then seasonally adjusted to support month-to-month comparisons. A reading above 50 indicates an expansion; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change. Chicago PMI is released one day before the ISM Manufacturing Index.

title: Caixin Manufacturing PMI
description: The Caixin China Manufacturing PMI™, which is published by S&P Global, gathers information from surveys sent to purchasing executives in more than 400 private manufacturing sector companies on a monthly basis.

title: Dallas Fed Services Index
description: The Dallas Fed conducts the Texas Service Sector Outlook Survey monthly to obtain a timely assessment of the state's service sector activity. Firms are asked whether revenue, employment, prices, general business activity and other indicators increased, decreased or remained unchanged over the previous month. Responses are aggregated into balance indexes where positive values generally indicate growth while negative values generally indicate contraction.

title: Commodity Prices YoY
description: Commodity Prices YoY measures the yearly change in the selling price of exported commodities. Commodity exports have on average accounted for more than half of Australia's export income. Because changes in export prices explain approximately three-quarters of the fluctuations in the growth of export values since 1990, developments in export prices can have a significant impact on export earnings and economic activity in Australia. The most important commodities in the RBA Index of Commodity Prices are iron ore (27.1 percent of the total weight), metallurgical coal (16 percent), LNG (15.8 percent), thermal coal (9.5 percent), gold (7.5 percent) and alumina (4.1 percent).

title: Istanbul Chamber of Industry Manufacturing PMI
description: The Istanbul Chamber of Industry Turkey PMI Manufacturing Index measures the performance of the manufacturing sector and is derived from a survey of 400 manufacturing companies. The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index is based on five individual indexes with the following weights: New Orders (30 percent), Output (25 percent), Employment (20 percent), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15 percent) and Stock of Items Purchased (10 percent), with the Delivery Times index inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction.  A reading above 50 indicates an expansion of the manufacturing sector compared to the previous month; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change.

title: procure.ch Manufacturing PMI
description: In Switzerland, the procure.ch Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index measures the performance of the manufacturing sector and is derived from a survey to executives on their procurement expectations for the following month. The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index is based on five individual indexes with the following weights: New Orders (30 percent), Output (25 percent), Employment (20 percent), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15 percent) and Stock of Items Purchased (10 percent), with the Delivery Times index inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction.  A reading above 50 indicates an expansion of the manufacturing sector compared to the previous month; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change.

title: RBA Commodity Index SDR (YoY)
description: The RBA Commodity Price SDR, published by the Reserve Bank of Australia, is seen as a leading indicator for changes in export prices. These price changes have an impact on GDP and exchange rates. If prices rise, it suggests a strong Australian dollar (AUD), while a decrease in prices indicates a weak AUD. A high reading is considered positive for the AUD, while a low reading is considered negative.

title: ABSA Manufacturing PMI
description: The Absa Manufacturing PMI is a monthly survey of purchasing managers in South Africa's manufacturing sector. The index provides leading indications of business conditions in the sector. A reading above 50 percent indicates that the manufacturing economy is generally expanding; below 50 percent indicates that it is generally declining.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The S&P Global's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) measures the state of the manufacturing sector and provides key insights into the Russian Federation's overall economic condition. When the PMI is above 50, it indicates positive business conditions and is typically favorable for the Ruble. Conversely, a PMI below 50 suggests negative conditions and is viewed as unfavorable for the Ruble.

title: S&P Global/CIPS Manufacturing PMI Final
description: Markit/CIPS UK Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index measures the performance of the manufacturing sector and is derived from a survey of 600 industrial companies. The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index is based on five individual indexes with the following weights: New Orders (30 percent), Output (25 percent), Employment (20 percent), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15 percent) and Stock of Items Purchased (10 percent), with the Delivery Times index inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction. A reading above 50 indicates an expansion of the manufacturing sector compared to the previous month; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change.

title: Purchasing Managers Index Manufacturing (MoM)
description: The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) is a gauge of business conditions in the manufacturing sector, provided by Silf and FöreningsSparbanken. Since the manufacturing sector contributes significantly to the overall GDP, the manufacturing PMI is a crucial indicator of business conditions and the overall economic situation in Sweden. If the PMI reading is above 50, it indicates a positive outlook for the Krona, while a reading below 50 suggests a negative outlook.

title: MBA Mortgage Applications
description: In the US, the MBA Weekly Mortgage Application Survey is a comprehensive overview of the nationwide mortgage market and covers all types of mortgage originators, including commercial banks, thrift institutions and mortgage banking companies. The entire market is represented by the Market Index which covers all mortgage applications during the week, whether for a purchase or to refinance. The survey covers over 75% of all US retail residential mortgage applications.

title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI
description: The PMI Manufacturing, released by S&P Global and Hamburg Commercial Bank (HCOB), measures business conditions in the manufacturing sector. Since the manufacturing sector plays a significant role in the overall GDP, this index is a crucial indicator for assessing business conditions and the overall economic state of Spain. A reading above 50 suggests positive sentiment for the Euro, while a reading below 50 indicates a negative sentiment.

title: Retail Sales
description: Retail Sales data, published by the Census and Statistics Department, reflects the overall amount of goods and services purchased by consumers from retail stores. This data is significant as it offers insights into consumer spending, which is a key component of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP). An increase in retail sales suggests a robust economic growth. However, if the surge in sales exceeds the predicted amount, it could lead to inflationary pressures.

title: HCOB Services PMI
description: The PMI for services, which is published by S&P Global and Hamburg Commercial Bank (HCOB), provides information about the state of business in the services sector. Since the services sector makes up a significant portion of the total GDP, the services PMI is a crucial indicator of France's overall economic health. If the PMI result is above 50, it is considered positive for the Euro, while a result below 50 is viewed as negative.

title: Business Confidence
source: INEGI - Instituto Nacional de Estadistica, Geografia e Informatica
description: In Mexico, the Monthly Survey of Business Opinion (EMOE) measures the expectations of business executives regarding production, capacity utilization, employment and inventories, in the short, medium and long run. The survey also trials the expectations concerning the general economic environment and how it may affect business activity. The EMOE has a national coverage and it is measured on a scale of 0 to 100, where levels above 50 indicate optimism, 50 neutrality and below 50 pessimism.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The S&P Global Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) measures the state of the manufacturing sector in Greece. It is a significant gauge of business conditions and the broader economic situation in the country. When the PMI is above 50, it is considered positive for the Euro, while a result below 50 is considered negative.

title: ADP Employment Change
description: The ADP National Employment Report measures levels of non-farm private employment. The Report is based on the actual payroll data from about 25 million employees and is produced by the ADP Research Institute in collaboration with the Stanford Digital Economy Lab.

title: Total New Vehicle Sales
description: In South Africa, total vehicle sales measure the total number of vehicles sold including buses and heavy vehicles in the reported month.

title: S&P Global/CIPS Manufacturing PMI
description: The PMI manufacturing data, released by both the Chartered Institute of Purchasing & Supply and S&P Global, reflects the economic conditions in the manufacturing industry in the UK. It is important to note that the performance of the service sector in the country does not have an impact on these results. Traders prefer to see a higher reading as it is seen as positive for the GBP. A reading above 50 indicates expansion, whereas a reading below 50 indicates contraction.

title: SNB Jordan Speech
description: In Switzerland, interest rate decisions are taken by the Swiss National Bank. The official interest rate is the SNB policy rate. The SNB seeks to keep the secured short-term Swiss franc money market rates close to the SNB policy rate. SARON is the most representative of these rates today. As of 13 June 2019, the SNB policy rate replaced the target range for the three-month Swiss franc Libor (London Interbank Offered Rate) previously used in the SNB's monetary policy strategy. The reason for this adjustment was that the Libor was becoming less relevant as the most important reference rate owing to the absence of the underlying money market transactions. From 6 September 2011 to 15 January 2015, the main focus of implementation was on the minimum exchange rate of CHF 1.20 per euro, which the SNB enforced during this period. On 18 December 2014, the SNB decided to impose an interest rate of -0.25% on sight deposit account balances. With the announcement of a negative interest rate, the Libor target range used then was taken into negative territory for the first time, and extended to its usual width of 1 percentage point. On 15 January 2015, the SNB lowered the interest rate on sight deposits to -0.75% and moved the target range downwards to between -1.25% and -0.25%. Negative interest has applied since 22 January 2015 and currently corresponds to the SNB policy rate.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The IHS Markit Canada Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index™ measures the performance of the manufacturing sector. The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index is based on five individual indexes with the following weights: New Orders (30 percent), Output (25 percent), Employment (20 percent), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15 percent) and Stock of Items Purchased (10 percent), with the Delivery Times index inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction.  A reading above 50 indicates an expansion of the manufacturing sector compared to the previous month; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI Final
description: The S&P Global US Manufacturing PMI is compiled by S&P Global from responses to questionnaires sent to purchasing managers in a panel of around 800 manufacturers. The headline figure is the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), which is a weighted average of the following five indices: New Orders (30%), Output (25%), Employment (20%), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15%) and Stocks of Purchases (10%). For the PMI calculation the Suppliers’ Delivery Times Index is inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction to the other indices. The index varies between 0 and 100, with a reading above 50 indicating an overall increase compared to the previous month, and below 50 an overall decrease.

title: ISM Manufacturing New Orders
description: The Manufacturing ISM Report On Business is based on data compiled from purchasing and supply executives nationwide. Survey responses reflect the change, if any, in the current month compared to the previous month. For each of the indicators measured (New Orders, Backlog of Orders, New Export Orders, Imports, Production, Supplier Deliveries, Inventories, Customers' Inventories, Employment and Prices), the report shows the percentage reporting each response, the net difference between the number of responses in the positive economic direction and the negative economic direction, and the diffusion index. A PMI reading above 50 percent indicates that the manufacturing economy is generally expanding; below 50 percent indicates that it is generally declining.

title: MBA Mortgage Applications
description: The Mortgage Bankers Association publishes the MBA Mortgage Applications report, which provides information on different types of mortgage applications. This report is considered a reliable indicator of the U.S. housing market and is used to assess its overall health. When there is an increase in mortgage applications, it indicates a strong housing market that can positively impact the entire U.S. economy. Typically, a high reading on this report is seen as favorable for the value of the U.S. dollar, while a low reading is viewed as unfavorable.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The Markit Mexico Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index measures the performance of the manufacturing sector and is derived from a survey of 400 manufacturing companies. The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index is based on five individual indexes with the following weights: New Orders (30 percent), Output (25 percent), Employment (20 percent), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15 percent) and Stock of Items Purchased (10 percent), with the Delivery Times index inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction. A reading above 50 indicates an expansion of the manufacturing sector compared to the previous month; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change.

title: ADP Employment Change
description: The Employment Change report from Automatic Data Processing, Inc measures the difference in the number of employed individuals in the United States. When this indicator increases, it typically indicates a boost in consumer spending, which helps to stimulate economic growth. Therefore, a high reading is generally viewed as positive or optimistic for the value of the US dollar, while a low reading is seen as negative or pessimistic.

title: SNB's Chairman Jordan speech
description: The words of Thomas J. Jordan, who serves as the leader of the Swiss National Bank, have the potential to greatly influence the worth of the country's currency. The market is constantly paying attention to any indications of the strategies the central bank may employ in the future. Traders frequently view his speeches as a chance to gather hints or information.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The Markit Manufacturing PMI is a report published by S&P Global. It gathers data from monthly surveys sent to purchasing executives in more than 400 industrial companies. The report assigns a value to indicate whether there has been an increase or decrease in a particular variable. A value above 50.0 suggests an overall increase, while a value below 50.0 suggests an overall decrease. The data in the report is adjusted to account for seasonal fluctuations.

title: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI
description: The S&P Global's Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) is a measure of business conditions specifically in the manufacturing sector. Given that the manufacturing sector plays a significant role in the overall GDP, the manufacturing PMI serves as a crucial indicator of business conditions and the state of the economy in the United States. If the PMI reading is above 50, it suggests that the economy is growing, which is generally seen as positive for the USD and perceived as a bullish signal by investors. On the other hand, if the PMI reading falls below 50, it indicates an economic contraction, which has a negative impact on the currency.

title: New Car Registrations YoY
source: ANFIA - Italian Association of the Automotive Industry

title: ISM Manufacturing PMI
description: The ISM Manufacturing Index is a crucial measure of business conditions in the US manufacturing industry. It serves as a key indicator of the overall economic health of the United States. If the index value is above 50, it is considered positive for the USD, while a value below 50 is seen as negative.

title: EIA Crude Oil Stocks Change
description: The EIA Crude Oil stockpiles report, published by the Energy Information Administration, provides a weekly update on the amount of crude oil and its byproducts held in storage. This report often causes significant fluctuations in oil prices, which in turn can have an impact on global economies, particularly on currencies tied to commodities like the Canadian dollar. While the report may not have a major effect on currencies, it does tend to influence the price of oil itself, especially impacting WTI crude futures.

title: Fed Interest Rate Decision
description: In the United States, the authority to set interest rates is divided between the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve (Board) and the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). The Board decides on changes in discount rates after recommendations submitted by one or more of the regional Federal Reserve Banks. The FOMC decides on open market operations, including the desired levels of central bank money or the desired federal funds market rate.

title: Fed Press Conference
description: In the United States, the authority to set interest rates is divided between the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve (Board) and the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). The Board decides on changes in discount rates after recommendations submitted by one or more of the regional Federal Reserve Banks. The FOMC decides on open market operations, including the desired levels of central bank money or the desired federal funds market rate.

title: BoC Gov Macklem Speech
description: In Canada, benchmark interest rate is set by the Bank of Canada's (BoC) Governing Council. The official interest rate is the Overnight Rate. Since 1996 the Bank Rate is set at the upper limit of an operating band for the money market overnight rate. Previously, from March 1980 until February 1996 the Bank Rate was set at 25 basis points above the weekly average tender rate for 3-month Treasury bills.

title: Fed Interest Rate Decision
description: A nation's central bank holds regular economic policy meetings, where various measures are taken, the most important being the interest rate set for loans to commercial banks. In the US, the Federal Reserve's Board of Governors meets every five to eight weeks and announces their decisions. If the interest rate is increased, it usually strengthens the US dollar, indicating healthy inflation. Conversely, a rate decrease suggests economic and inflationary problems and tends to weaken the USD. When rates remain unchanged, the focus shifts to the tone of the FOMC statement, indicating whether it is optimistic or pessimistic about future inflation.

title: FOMC Press Conference
description: The press conference held by the Federal Reserve typically lasts for around one hour and consists of two segments. The first part involves the reading of a prepared statement, while the second part allows members of the press to ask questions. These questions often result in unplanned responses, which can have a significant impact on market stability.

title: Total Vehicle Sales
description: The Autodata Corp. provides data on Total Vehicle sales, which is a measure of vehicle sales in the United States. This data is often used as an indicator of consumer confidence. When the Total Vehicle sales reading is high, it is viewed as positive or bullish for the USD. Conversely, when the reading is low, it is seen as negative or bearish.

title: BoC's Governor Macklem speech
description: Tiff Macklem became the Governor of the Bank of Canada on June 3, 2020. In this role, he is responsible for leading the Bank and serving as the Chairman of its Board of Directors. Prior to this appointment, Macklem was the Dean of the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto for six years. He also previously served as the Senior Deputy Governor of the Bank of Canada from July 2010 to May 2014. Additionally, Macklem played a significant role in promoting financial stability as the first Chair of the Financial Stability Board's Standing Committee for Standards Implementation from 2009 to 2013, representing the Bank of Canada at the FSB.

title: Foreign Bond Investment
description: The net data shows the difference between acquisition and disposition of long-term debt securities: a plus sign indicates net purchases of foreign securities by Japanese investors; a minus sign indicates net selling and inflows of funds into Japan. It excludes Bank of Japan.

title: Foreign Investment in Japan Stocks
description: Securities investment, as defined by the Ministry of Finance, refers to the issuance of bonds in a domestic market by a foreign entity using the domestic currency. The Ministry of Finance releases a report on this, specifically highlighting the financial inflows and outflows from the public sector, excluding the Bank of Japan. The net data presented in the report shows the difference between the amount of capital flowing into the country and the amount flowing out. A positive difference indicates that residents have sold more foreign securities than they have purchased (resulting in capital inflow), while a negative difference indicates that residents have purchased more foreign securities than they have sold (resulting in capital outflow).

title: Trade Balance (MoM)
description: The trade balance, as reported by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, refers to the discrepancy between the value of imports and exports of Australian goods. The export data can be a useful indicator of Australian economic growth, while imports can provide insight into domestic demand. The trade balance gives an early indication of the overall export performance. If there is consistent demand for Australian exports, this can result in a positive growth in the trade balance, which would be beneficial for the Australian dollar (AUD).

title: 10-y Bond Auction
description: The calendar shows the average yield of the bonds sold by the Ministry of Finance in Japan. This yield indicates the amount of return an investor can expect from holding the bond until it matures.

title: Inflation Rate MoM
description: In Switzerland, the most important categories in the consumer price index are: Housing and energy (27 percent of the total weight) and Healthcare (18 percent). Transport accounts for 10 percent; Food and non-alcoholic beverages for 12 percent; Restaurants and hotels for 7 percent; and Recreation and culture for 7 percent. The index also includes: Miscellaneous goods and services (6 percent); Household goods and services (4 percent); and Clothing and footwear (3 percent). Communication, Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco and Education account for the remaining 6 percent of total weight.

title: Budget Balance
source: Ministère de l'Économie et des Finances
