description: The government budget balance is the difference between government revenues and expenses, including the treasure special component. The budget is balanced when outlays equal to receipts, the country reports budget surplus when revenues are higher than expenses and deficit when expenses exceed the revenues.

title: Consumer Confidence
description: In Switzerland, the consumer confidence survey is conducted every year, in the months of January, April, July and October. Around 1000 households are questioned for State Secretariat for Economic Affairs regarding their subjective evaluation of the economic situation, financial situation of the household in question, inflation, job security etc. Generally consumer confidence is high when the unemployment rate is low and GDP growth is high. Measures of average consumer confidence can be useful indicators of how much consumers are likely to spend.

title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI
description: The S&P Global Spain Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index measures the performance of the manufacturing sector and is derived from a survey of 400 industrial companies. The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index is based on five individual indexes with the following weights: New Orders (30 percent), Output (25 percent), Employment (20 percent), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15 percent) and Stock of Items Purchased (10 percent), with the Delivery Times index inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction.  A reading above 50 indicates an expansion of the manufacturing sector compared to the previous month; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change.

title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI
description: In Italy, the Markit Italy Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index measures the performance of the manufacturing sector and is derived from a survey of 400 industrial companies. The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index is based on five individual indexes with the following weights: New Orders (30 percent), Output (25 percent), Employment (20 percent), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15 percent) and Stock of Items Purchased (10 percent), with the Delivery Times index inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction. A reading above 50 indicates an expansion of the manufacturing sector compared to the previous month; below 50 represents a contraction; while 50 indicates no change.

title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI Final
description: The HCOB France Manufacturing PMI is compiled by S&P Global from responses to monthly questionnaires sent to purchasing managers in a panel of around 400 manufacturers. The headline figure is the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), which is a weighted average of the following five indices: New Orders (30%), Output (25%), Employment (20%), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15%) and Stocks of Purchases (10%). For the PMI calculation the Suppliers’ Delivery Times Index is inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction to the other indices. The index varies between 0 and 100, with a reading above 50 indicating an overall increase compared to the previous month, and below 50 an overall decrease.

title: Unemployed Persons
description: In Germany, unemployed persons are individuals who are without a job and actively seeking to work.

title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI Final
description: The HCOB Eurozone Manufacturing PMI is compiled by S&P Global from responses to monthly questionnaires sent to survey panels of manufacturers in Germany, France, Italy, Spain, the Netherlands, Austria, Ireland and Greece, totaling around 3,000 private sector companies. The headline figure is the Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI), which is a weighted average of the following five indices: New Orders (30%), Output (25%), Employment (20%), Suppliers’ Delivery Times (15%) and Stocks of Purchases (10%). For the PMI calculation the Suppliers’ Delivery Times Index is inverted so that it moves in a comparable direction to the other indices. The index varies between 0 and 100, with a reading above 50 indicating an overall increase compared to the previous month, and below 50 an overall decrease.

title: Day of the Dead
description: Bank closures will occur in observance of the Day of the Dead.

title: 10-Year OAT Auction
description: Generally, a government bond is issued by a national government and is denominated in the country`s own currency. Bonds issued by national governments in foreign currencies are normally referred to as sovereign bonds. The yield required by investors to loan funds to governments reflects inflation expectations and the likelihood that the debt will be repaid.

title: Consumer Price Index (YoY)
description: The Swiss Federal Statistical Office releases the Consumer Price Index (CPI) which tracks the average price fluctuations of goods and services bought by households for consumption. CPI is a critical tool for monitoring inflation and shifts in purchasing habits. Inflation reduces the purchasing power of the Swiss Franc (CHF), so a higher CPI reading is beneficial for the CHF, whereas a lower reading is unfavorable.

title: Budget Balance
description: The Budget Balance, as reported by MINEFA, is the discrepancy between the amount of money earned and spent during a budget period. A positive amount indicates a surplus, while a negative amount indicates a deficit, revealing the need for borrowing. Typically, a surplus is considered favorable or optimistic for the Euro, while a deficit is viewed as unfavorable or pessimistic.

title: Foreign Exchange Reserves
description: In Mexico, Foreign Exchange Reserves are the foreign assets held or controlled by the country central bank. The reserves are made of gold or a specific currency. They can also be special drawing rights and marketable securities denominated in foreign currencies like treasury bills, government bonds, corporate bonds and equities and foreign currency loans.

title: Exports
description: The data from TurkStat on exports represents the amount of goods and services that are sent out of Turkey. When there is a consistent demand for Turkish exports, it can contribute to an increase in the trade surplus, which is beneficial for the Lira currency.

title: Challenger Job Cuts
description: Challenger Job-Cut Report provides information on the number of announced corporate layoffs by industry and region.

title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI
description: The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI), which is published by S&P Global and Hamburg Commercial Bank (HCOB), measures business conditions in the manufacturing sector. Since the manufacturing sector has a significant impact on the overall GDP, the manufacturing PMI is a crucial indicator for assessing business conditions and the overall economic situation in Italy. If the result is above 50, it is considered positive for the Euro, while a result below 50 is seen as negative.

title: HCOB Manufacturing PMI
description: The Manufacturing Purchasing Managers Index (PMI) provided by S&P Global and Hamburg Commercial Bank (HCOB) measures the state of the manufacturing industry. Since the manufacturing industry plays a significant role in the overall GDP, the manufacturing PMI is a key indicator of the economic conditions in France. A reading above 50 indicates positive conditions and is considered favorable for the Euro, while a reading below 50 suggests negative conditions.

title: Unemployment Change
description: The Unemployment Change, which is released by the Bundesagentur für Arbeit and published by the German Statistics Office, is a measure that shows the total change in the number of unemployed individuals in Germany using data that has been adjusted for seasonal factors. An increase in this measurement has negative consequences for consumer spending because fewer people are employed, which leads to a decrease in economic growth within the country. Typically, if the reading is higher than expected, it is viewed as negative (or bearish) for the EUR currency, while a lower reading is seen as positive (or bullish).

title: BoE Interest Rate Decision
description: In the United Kingdom, benchmark interest rate is set by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC). The Bank of England official interest rate is the repo rate. This repo rate applies to open market operations of the Bank of England with a group of counterparties (banks, building societies, securities firms).

title: Unemployment
description: The National Institute of Statistics publishes the Unemployment Rate, which is calculated by dividing the number of unemployed workers by the total civilian labor force. This rate is an important measure for the Italian economy as it indicates whether there is growth or stagnation in the labor market. A higher rate suggests a lack of expansion, which in turn weakens the overall economy. On the other hand, a decrease in the rate is generally viewed as a positive or optimistic sign for the Euro currency, while an increase is seen as negative or pessimistic.

title: 10-y Obligaciones Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on the Bonos del Tesoro sold by Tesoro Público. These Spanish bonds have a maturity of more than five years. The yield on the bonds represents the profit that investors can expect by holding the bond until it reaches maturity. Investors closely track the volatility of the yield and compare the average rate at auction with rates from previous auctions of the same bonds. This serves as an indicator of the government's debt situation.

title: Total Vehicle Sales
description: In the United States, Total Vehicle Sales measures the annualized number of new vehicles sold domestically in the reported month.

title: CBRT Quarterly Inflation Report
description: The Central Bank of the Republic of Turkey (CBRT) releases a comprehensive analysis of Turkey's current economic situation called the quarterly inflation report. This report provides detailed forecasts for inflation and growth in the short-term and medium-term.

title: EIA Natural Gas Stocks Change
description: Natural Gas Stocks Change refers to the weekly change of the natural gas supply situation.

title: Challenger Job Cuts
description: Every month, Challenger, Grey & Christmas releases Challenger Job Cuts, a report that reveals the number of announced corporate layoffs in various industries and regions. This report is often used by investors as a gauge to assess the overall health of the job market.

title: BoE Asset Purchase Facility
description: The Asset Purchase Facility is a monetary policy measure implemented by the Bank of England. It involves the creation of money and its injection into the economy through the purchase of open market bonds. This tool, also known as Quantitative Easing, is used to influence long-term interest rates.

title: BoE's Governor Bailey speech
description: Andrew Bailey became the Governor of the Bank of England on March 16th, 2020, succeeding Mark Carney. Prior to this role, Bailey was the Chief Executive of the Financial Conduct Authority. He also held positions as the Deputy Governor of the Bank of England from April 2013 to July 2016 and as the Chief Cashier of the Bank of England from January 2004 to April 2011.

title: Central Bank Reserves $
description: The Central Bank of the Russian Federation has published the Central Bank Reserves, which indicates the amount of foreign currency and gold reserves held by the bank. These reserves serve as a safeguard for countries that are vulnerable to financial crises and can also be used to influence exchange rates. A high reading of these reserves is considered favorable for the Russian Ruble, while a low reading is seen as unfavorable.

title: EIA Natural Gas Storage Change
description: The information provided is estimated and is obtained through a calculation process that incorporates both monthly survey data from the Energy Information Administration (EIA) and weekly survey data from the American Gas Association (AGA).

title: Culture Day
description: Banks will not be open on Culture Day as it is a bank holiday.

title: 4-Week Bill Auction
description: The calendar shows the average return on Treasury bills sold by the US Department of Treasury. These bills are short-term investments that mature in one year or less. The return, or yield, on these bills is the amount of money an investor will earn by holding the bond until it matures. Investors keep an eye on the volatility of the yield and compare the average rate at each auction to the rate at previous auctions of the same security. This helps them gauge the government's debt situation.

title: Judo Bank Services PMI Final
description: The Judo Bank Australia Services PMI is compiled by S&P Global from responses to questionnaires sent to a panel of around 400 service sector companies. The sectors covered include consumer (excluding retail), transport, information, communication, finance, insurance, real estate and business services. The headline figure is the Services Business Activity Index. This is a diffusion index calculated from a question that asks for changes in the volume of business activity compared with one month previously. The Services Business Activity Index is comparable to the Manufacturing Output Index. The index varies between 0 and 100, with a reading above 50 indicating an overall increase compared to the previous month, and below 50 an overall decrease.

title: ECB Schnabel Speech
description: In the Euro Area, benchmark interest rate is set by the Governing Council of the European Central Bank. The primary objective of the ECB’s monetary policy is to maintain price stability which is to keep inflation below, but close to 2 percent over the medium term. In times of prolonged low inflation and low interest rates, ECB may also adopt non-standard monetary policy measures, such as asset purchase programmes. The official interest rate is the Main refinancing operations rate.

title: RBA Jones Speech
description: In Australia, interest rates decisions are taken by the Reserve Bank of Australia's Board. The official interest rate is the cash rate. The cash rate is the rate charged on overnight loans between financial intermediaries, is determined in the money market as a result of the interaction of demand for and supply of overnight funds.

title: Retail Sales MoM Final
description: In Australia, the Retail sales report provides an aggregated measure of sales of retail goods and services over a specific time period. In Australia, Retail sales are seasonal, volatile and relatively important to the overall economy.

title: Imports MoM
description: In 2021, Germany main imports were: computer, electronic and optical products (11 percent of total imports); motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers (10 percent); chemicals and chemical products (8 percent); machinery and equipment (8 percent); electrical equipment (7 percent); basic metals (6 percent); crude petroleum and natural gas (6 percent); basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations (6 percent); and food products (4 percent). Main import partners were China (12 percent of total imports), the Netherlands (9 percent), the US and Poland (6 percent each), Italy and France (5 percent each), Belgium, Czech Republic, Switzerland and Austria (4 percent each).

title: S&P Global PMI
description: In South Africa, the IHS Markit South Africa Purchasing Managers Index tracks business trends across private sector activity, including mining, manufacturing, services, construction and retail based on data collected from a representative panel of around 400 companies. The index tracks variables such as new orders, output, employment, supplier delivery times, inventories and prices. A reading above 50 indicates expansion in business activity and below 50 indicates that it is generally declining.

title: Industrial Production MoM
description: In France, industrial production measures the output of businesses integrated in industrial sector of the economy. Manufacturing is the most important sector and accounts for 86 percent of total production. The biggest segments within Manufacturing are: Food products and beverages (13 percent of total production); machinery and equipment goods (13 percent), of which computer, electronic and optical products (5 percent); basic metals and fabricated metal products (12 percent); other manufacturing, repair and installation of machinery and equipment (12 percent); transport equipment (10 percent); rubber and plastics products, and other non-metallic mineral products (8 percent); and chemicals and chemical products (6 percent). Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning account for 11 percent of total output, Water supply, sewerage, waste management and remediation account for 1 percent and Mining and quarrying account also for 1 percent.

title: Unemployment Change
source: Ministerio de Empleo y Seguridad Social
description: Unemployment Change in Spain measures the change in the number of unemployed compared to the previous month.

title: Unemployment Rate
description: In Italy, the unemployment rate measures the number of people actively looking for a job as a percentage of the labour force.

title: S&P Global/CIPS Composite PMI Final
description: The UK Composite PMI is a weighted average of the Manufacturing Output Index and the Services Business Activity Index.

title: Unemployment Rate
description: In Euro Area, the unemployment rate measures the number of people actively looking for a job as a percentage of the labour force.

title: Gross Fixed Investment YoY
source: INEGI - Instituto Nacional de Estadistica, Geografia e Informatica
description: The Gross Fixed Investment in Mexico measures the total value of all acquisitions of fixed assets, both tangible and intangible, obtained as a result of a production process. Those are only ones which can be repeatedly used in other production processes in a period longer than one year. The value represents a year over year change of the gross fixed investment, obtained by aggregating the constant values of machinery and equipment of both national and foreign origin and of construction. They are: buildings, machinery, equipment, transport equipment, software, literary originals and other tangible and intangible fixed assets and additions and upgrades meant to prolong the usage or increase capacity. Considering the machinery and equipment of national origin, only new products are counted. Both new and used imported machinery and equipment increase the value of assets available in the country. The construction gross fixed investment index refers to the investment cost valued at the buyers cost.

title: BoE Pill Speech
description: In the United Kingdom, benchmark interest rate is set by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC). The Bank of England official interest rate is the repo rate. This repo rate applies to open market operations of the Bank of England with a group of counterparties (banks, building societies, securities firms).

title: Manufacturing Payrolls
description: Manufacturing Payrolls reports the absolute change in the number of employees working in the Manufacturing sector in the United States.

title: S&P Global Composite PMI Final
description: In the United States, the S&P Global Composite PMI Output Index, which is a weighted average of the Manufacturing Output Index and the Services Business Activity Index, tracks business trends across both manufacturing and service sectors. The index is based on data collected from a representative panel of over 800 companies and follows variables such as sales, new orders, employment, inventories and prices. A reading above 50 indicates expansion in business activity while below 50 points to contraction.

title: ISM Services Prices
description: The Non-Manufacturing ISM Report On Business is based on data compiled from purchasing and supply executives nationwide. Survey responses reflect the change, if any, in the current month compared to the previous month. For each of the indicators measured (Business Activity, New Orders, Backlog of Orders, New Export Orders, Inventory Change, Inventory Sentiment, Imports, Prices, Employment and Supplier Deliveries) this report shows the percentage reporting each response, and the diffusion index. An index reading above 50 percent indicates that the non-manufacturing economy in that index is generally expanding; below 50 percent indicates that it is generally declining. Orders to the service producers make up about 90 percent of the US economy.
